comments: He knows his stuffs. He was not afraid of teaching students how to meditate. I highly recommend his Zen Buddhism class. It was very nice to learn Buddhism from a real practitioner.
Professor is a wonderful person, very warm and supportive. But classes not too focused, and explanations not always clear.

Ryan is a fantastic professor. He loves what he is teaching. Last semester, he had a panel come in, along with several guest speakers. He gave us a variety of views and opinions. His readings were also very interesting. And, he would admit when he did not know a lot about something -- more helpful than pretending. I am glad to have him at Hampshire
Awesome professor. Understanding, helpful, clear, and obviously personally engaged with the material. I\'ve taken two classes with him and definitely would do so again.

Ryan is a wonderful, engaging, person to work with. He is really into conversation based classes and interactive learning. he might even take the class on an interesting field trip or bring in a speaker that relates to the reading. In addition, You might get some mediation or chanting experience. =)
His Zen Buddhism class was awesome! He is an excellent teacher.
I enjoyed his course, theories of religions. It was challenging at the beginning but became very reward at the end. He is a kind and good professor.

I absolutely loved this class. I believe that "studying Buddhism through material objects" is one of the best ways to learn about Buddhism. Ryan was easily approachable, and passionate about the course. We were given a good grasp of topics through reading and discussion, but also through direct experience (e.g. chanting) where appropriate.

He is very smart and kind, he\'s just not very good at conveying information in an organized fashion. I also felt as if his class was being taught in a very kindergarden-like style, not appealing as a college student. He also really likes youtube videos and using the internet as a way to connect the class.
